alert.note: Alert for Casey; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT/4 PM CDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky and south central Kentucky, including the following counties, in SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Casey. In south central Kentucky, Russell. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT /400 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 255 PM EDT /155 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Russell Springs, Fonthill, Horntown, Jericho, Webbs Cross Roads, Decatur, Sycamore Flat, Honey Acre, Eli and Whittle. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
